title: Authors and Citation
text: Singhal B (2025). sparseNumeric: Sparse Numeric Vector S4 Class Utilities. R package version 0.1.0.
code: @Manual{,   title = {sparseNumeric: Sparse Numeric Vector S4 Class and Utilities},   author = {Bhavik Singhal},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.1.0}, }

what: Sparse Numeric Vector S4 Class and Utilities
title: Sparse Numeric Vector S4 Class and Utilities
text: sparseNumeric provides S4 class (sparse_numeric) representing sparse numeric vectors along efficient operations addition, subtraction, elementwise multiplication, cross-products, mean, norm, standardization. package useful working numeric vectors contain many zeros, allowing store non-zero entries.

title: Sparse Numeric Vector S4 Class and Utilities
text: can install development version sparseNumeric GitHub:

title: Sparse Numeric Vector S4 Class and Utilities
text: basic example showing construct sparse vectors carry arithmetic operations:
code: library(sparseNumeric)  # Create two numeric vectors x <- c(0, 5, 0, 3) y <- c(2, 0, 0, 7)  # Convert to sparse_numeric sx <- as(x, "sparse_numeric") sy <- as(y, "sparse_numeric")  # Addition sparse_add(sx, sy) #> An object of class sparse_numeric ...  # Elementwise multiplication sparse_mult(sx, sy)  # Compute the Euclidean norm norm(sx)  # Standardize the vector standardize(sx)

title: Sparse Numeric Vector S4 Class and Utilities
text: compact S4 representation sparse numeric vectors Vectorized arithmetic: +, -, * sparse_add() sparse_sub() sparse_mult() sparse_crossprod() nnzero() standardize() norm() custom plot() method visualizing overlapping non-zero entries Full documentation examples package website (built pkgdown)

title: Sparse Numeric Vector S4 Class and Utilities
text: package built UT Austin SDS 375 Data Product course includes: Test coverage using testthat Automated documentation using roxygen2 pkgdown website GitHub Actions CI (R CMD check)

title: Coerce numeric to sparse_numeric — coerce_numeric_to_sparse_numeric
text: Converts dense numeric vector sparse_numeric object storing non-zero entries.

title: Coerce sparse_numeric to numeric — coerce_sparse_to_numeric
text: Expands sparse_numeric object full dense numeric representation.

text: Computes mean sparse_numeric vector including implicit zeros, without converting dense representation.

what: Sparse numeric vector S4 class — sparse_numeric-class
title: Sparse numeric vector S4 class — sparse_numeric-class
text: sparse_numeric class stores numeric vector sparse format using three slots: value Numeric vector non-zero entries. pos Integer vector positions (1-based) non-zero entries. length Single non-negative integer giving total length dense vector.

title: Sparse numeric vector S4 class — sparse_numeric-class
text: value Numeric vector non-zero entries. pos Integer vector 1-based positions non-zero entries. length Single non-negative integer giving full vector length.

title: Subtract two sparse_numeric vectors with - — -,sparse_numeric,sparse_numeric-method
text: operator alias sparse_sub, allowing write x - y sparse_numeric objects.

title: Subtract two sparse_numeric vectors with - — -,sparse_numeric,sparse_numeric-method
code: # S4 method for class 'sparse_numeric,sparse_numeric' e1 - e2

title: Subtract two sparse_numeric vectors — sparse_sub
text: Computes elementwise difference two sparse_numeric vectors length.

title: Subtract two sparse_numeric vectors — sparse_sub
code: sparse_sub(x, y)  # S4 method for class 'sparse_numeric,sparse_numeric' sparse_sub(x, y)

title: Standardize a sparse_numeric vector — standardize
text: Centers scales sparse_numeric vector subtracting mean dividing standard deviation, statistics computed full vector including implicit zeros.

title: Standardize a sparse_numeric vector — standardize
code: standardize(x, ...)  # S4 method for class 'sparse_numeric' standardize(x, ...)
